title: Free-to-play optimal quest guide

properties.name: description
properties.value: Unlike the main Optimal quest guide, this free-to-play optimal quest guide focuses mostly on optimizing the progress through many different quests at once, instead of optimizing for quest experience rewards. Because many free-to-play quests can be completed more efficiently by combining their progress, most of these quests are grouped together by region. When following this guide, make sure to look at the Additional info column for not just the current quest in progress, but also at the next one or two quests, in order to more optimally prepare for the next quests.

content:
The RuneScape Wiki also has an article on: rsw:Quests/Strategy
For the Ironman variant of this guide, see Optimal quest guide/Free-to-play/Ironman.
Note that this guide focuses on rapid completion of all free-to-play quests. Newer players are advised to complete quests as they go, taking their time, and enjoy the rest of the game in the mean time.

Unlike the main Optimal quest guide, this free-to-play optimal quest guide focuses mostly on optimizing the progress through many different quests at once, instead of optimizing for quest experience rewards. Because many free-to-play quests can be completed more efficiently by combining their progress, most of these quests are grouped together by region. When following this guide, make sure to look at the Additional info column for not just the current quest in progress, but also at the next one or two quests, in order to more optimally prepare for the next quests.

The Additional info column will list which other quests need to be progressed during the completion of this quest, for optimal quest progress. This list does not recommend specific combat level requirements, and experienced players should be able to do all quests except for Dragon Slayer I without training skills in between doing the quests. This requires knowledge of how to safe spot Count Draynor, however, so inexperienced players may need to train combat stats before taking on this boss.

After completing all quests except for Dragon Slayer I, it is recommended that players focus on other gameplay, since this final free-to-play quest requires significantly higher stats than any other available quest. See the quest guide for an indication of this quest's difficulty.

Guide[edit | edit source]

Some items like beads, a redberry pie and blue dye are recommended to be bought on the Grand Exchange if possible. Alternate methods of obtaining these items for Ironmen and players who wish to obtain these items for themselves are given throughout the guide.

The Bring from bank column only lists items that are required until the next time banking. Items obtained while following this part of the guide, or items obtainable during the quest (such as shears during Sheep Shearer) will not be listed.


Free-to-play optimal quest guide
Quest/Activity Quick Guide New levels after quest Quest points Total QP Additional info Bring from bank
Tutorial Island N/A
10   Hitpoints
 0 0
Bank all items after finishing the tutorial and before continuing quests, to make space for wool during Sheep Shearer.
Cook's Assistant QG
4   Cooking
 1 1
Collect ingredients while doing X Marks the Spot, and collect an extra pot of flour for Prince Ali Rescue.
Ironman players should collect several extra pots of flour to bake a redberry pie for The Knight's Sword, and bread for Below Ice Mountain if you lost the one from tutorial island.
Also start Rune Mysteries, Restless Ghost and Prince Ali Rescue in order to be able to complete parts of these quests later.
Pot
Bucket
Sheep Shearer QG
2   Crafting
 1 2
Shear and spin three extra balls of wool, to use during Prince Ali Rescue.
X Marks the Spot QG
4   Prayer
 1 3
On the way to Draynor Village make a quick stop at Wizards' Tower to talk to Wizard Sedridor for Rune Mysteries.
Use 300xp reward on Prayer to shorten a long future prayer grind for Dragon Slayer I.
Start Vampyre Slayer while in Draynor Village.
Optional: Buy a chronicle in Draynor Village for easy teleports to Varrock later on.
Air talisman
3 Coins or a Spade
Pirate's Treasure QG 2 5
Buy 3 beers in the Rusty Anchor Inn to use in Prince Ali Rescue.
Complete up to the point where you need to go to Varrock. Complete the rest of the quest during Rune Mysteries.
For ironmen: kill imps on Karamja Volcano while on the island, to obtain the four different coloured beads.
66 coins
Rune Mysteries QG 1 6
While visiting Aubury, buy the following items in the Grand Exchange. For money, complete the Stronghold of Security for 10,000.
All four beads for a total of 5,567
Blue dye for 277
2 Iron ore for 128
2 Iron bars and a Redberry pie for 376 and 65 respectively.
A cooked meat and bread if the bread from tutorial island is lost.
Complete Romeo and Juliet while visiting Varrock.
Start Demon Slayer while in Varrock, and finish all steps that take place within Varrock.
Re-fill the bucket of water used in the quest, to create soft clay later.
Finish this quest later when doing Imp Catcher.
Research package
Romeo & Juliet QG 5 11
Complete this quest while in Varrock for Rune Mysteries.
Grab 5 redberries (4 if you bought a redberry pie, or more in case you burn your redberry pie) during this quest for later use.
While in Varrock, also visit the Blue Moon Inn to progress further in Vampyre Slayer and Pirate's Treasure.
Buy a pink skirt from Thessalia's Fine Clothes
Mine 7 clay south-west of Varrock − 6 clay for Doric's Quest and to create 1 soft clay using your bucket of water from earlier.
Chest key
4 coins
Bronze pickaxe
Bucket of water
The Restless Ghost QG
11   Prayer
 1 12
Every step of this quest can be done in parallel with Prince Ali Rescue.
Talk to Father Urhney on your way to Draynor Village to get the key imprint,
Talk to the restless ghost on your way to Osman to get the bronze key made,
Grab the ghost's skull when, after obtaining the bronze key, you complete Imp Catcher and Rune Mysteries.
Keep the skull in your bank to complete this quest later, along with Prince Ali Rescue, after Demon Slayer.
Prince Ali Rescue QG 3 15
Buy some red and an extra yellow dye from Aggie and combine them to create orange dye for Goblin Diplomacy.
Follow the steps in The Restless Ghost as described above.
After talking to the ghost for the first time, complete Misthalin Mystery as described below.
Complete The Restless Ghost, Rune Mysteries and Imp Catcher after getting the key, and also obtain the silverlight key for Demon Slayer.
Finish the last step for this quest after Demon Slayer.
Onion × 4
Redberries × 4
15 Coins
Ashes
Pot of flour
Bucket of water
Ball of wool × 3
Soft clay
Misthalin Mystery QG
7   Crafting
 1 16
Mine 5 Copper and 1 Tin in the nearby mine
Smelt a bronze bar for Prince Ali Rescue in Al Kharid
Bank the remaining ore for Doric's Quest.
Save the bucket of water for later, to create skin paste.
Bronze pickaxe
Imp Catcher QG
8   Magic
 1 17
Bring all four beads, the Rune Mysteries notes, and 23 bones, giving you a full inventory.
First hand in the beads on the top floor and kill two chickens in the basement for their bones.
Grab the ghost's skull to progress The Restless Ghost, and finish Rune Mysteries while in the tower basement.
Go to the 1st floor[UK]2nd floor[US], and collect the silverlight key from Wizard Traiborn in exchange for the 25 bones.
Black bead
Red bead
White bead
Yellow bead
Notes
Bones × 23
Ernest the Chicken QG 4 21
Grab a bronze med helm while exiting Draynor Manor to use during Black Knights' Fortress.
Hammer
Stake
Garlic
Combat equipment and food
(Combine this quest with Vampyre Slayer)
Vampyre Slayer QG
20   Attack
 3 24
Difficult boss fight at very low levels. Either:
Train some melee stats before completing this quest, or
Use of the safespot when killing Count Draynor.
Grab a bronze med helm when exiting Draynor Manor to use during Black Knights' Fortress.
Hammer
Stake
Garlic
combat equipment and food
Doric's Quest QG
10   Mining
 1 25
Pick a cabbage at Falador farm (NOT at Draynor Manor!) on the way to Doric.
Ironman players should collect enough raw beef to get at least one cooked meat for Below Ice Mountain.
Walk through Falador and buy an Iron chainbody at Wayne's Chains.
Finish Pirate's Treasure and buy some woad leaves to use in Goblin Diplomacy if you did not buy blue dye at the Grand Exchange.
Start Black Knights' Fortress and The Knight's Sword in the White Knights' Castle.
Note: Ironmen will have to train to level 15 to mine Iron ore, e.g. in the Dwarven Mine.
Iron ore × 2
Copper ore × 4
Clay × 6

Bronze med helm
Iron chainbody
Cabbage

Black Knights' Fortress QG 3 28
Start Below Ice Mountain on the way to the fortress.
Bronze med helm
Iron chainbody
Cabbage
Shield of Arrav QG 1 29
Passing through Barbarian Village, recruit Checkal for Below Ice Mountain
Ask Reldo about Imcando Dwarves, to progress The Knight's Sword as well.
Grab a knife upstairs in the Varrock general store on the way south.
Ask Charlie the Tramp about Marley.
Ask the Blue Moon Inn Cook about Marley.
Demon Slayer QG 3 32 Silverlight key (Captain Rovin)
Silverlight key (Sir Prysin)
Silverlight key (Wizard Traiborn)
Armour and food
Ghost's skull
Below Ice Mountain QG 1 33
After finishing the quest, teleport to Lumbridge
Finish The Restless Ghost,
Head to Al Kharid to finish Prince Ali Rescue.
Bake a redberry pie next to the Al Kharid bank, if you did not buy one on the Grand Exchange.
Collect the required items for the next quests and head south of Al Kharid, to Shantay Pass.
Talk to Shantay to get transported to Port Sarim. See Shantay Pass#Transport to Port Sarim Jail for more information.
Bread (or ingredients to make one)
Cooked meat
Knife
3
The Knight's Sword QG
29   Smithing
 1 34
Kill a giant rat just outside Port Sarim Jail for its meat.
Buy an eye of newt from Betty's Magic Emporium in Port Sarim
Talk to Captain Tock north to start The Corsair Curse
Optional: Visit Aggie to buy some blue dye if you don't have some already.
Complete the next two quests right after the first visit to Thurgo, before returning to Falador.
3
Onion
Weapons, armour and good food for The Corsair Curse
Witch's Potion QG
10   Magic
 1 35 Onion
Eye of newt
Burnt meat
The Corsair Curse QG 2 37
May require training combat stats before the final battle
Combat gear and good food.
Goblin Diplomacy QG
8   Crafting
 5 42
Finish The Knight's Sword on the way back north, by passing through Falador.
Orange dye
Blue dye
Train Magic from level 10 to level 33
Train Prayer from level 11 to level 37
Dragon Slayer I QG
33   Defence
33   Strength
 2 44
Fairly high combat stats are highly recommended.
Grants ability to wear the rune platebody, green d'hide body and dragon platebody.
See quest guide

Newer players are advised to complete quests as they go, taking their time, and enjoy the rest of the game in the mean time.'' Unlike [[../|the main Optimal quest guide]], this '''free-to-play optimal quest guide''' focuses mostly on optimizing the progress through many different quests at once, instead of optimizing for quest experience rewards. Because many [[free-to-play]] quests can be completed more efficiently by combining their progress, most of these quests are grouped together by region. When following this guide, make sure to look at the ''Additional info'' column for not just the current quest in progress, but also at the next one or two quests, in order to more optimally prepare for the next quests. The ''Additional info'' column will list which other quests need to be progressed during the completion of this quest, for optimal quest progress. This list does not recommend specific combat level requirements, and experienced players should be able to do all quests except for [[Dragon Slayer I]] without training skills in between doing the quests. This requires knowledge of how to safe spot [[Count Draynor]], however, so inexperienced players may need to train combat stats before taking on this boss. After completing all quests except for Dragon Slayer I, it is recommended that players focus on other gameplay, since this final free-to-play quest requires significantly higher stats than any other available quest. See [[Dragon Slayer I|the quest guide]] for an indication of this quest's difficulty. ==Guide== Some items like [[beads]], a [[redberry pie]] and [[blue dye]] are recommended to be bought on the [[Grand Exchange]] if possible. Alternate methods of obtaining these items for [[Ironman Mode|Ironmen]] and players who wish to obtain these items for themselves are given throughout the guide. The ''Bring from bank'' column '''only''' lists items that are required until the next time banking.
